newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's PHIBOR mostly softer as peso rates rise.
newsitem.headline: Manila's PHIBOR mostly softer as peso rates rise.

text.p: Philippine interbank offered rates (PHIBOR) were mostly softer to steady on Wednesday, except for one-week money which rose to 11.875 percent from 11.8125, dealers said.
Manila's overnight call loan rate edged up to 11.96875 percent from 11.84375 on Wednesday despite a cut in the Central Bank overnight rates due to tightening liquidity.
"Only the one-week PHIBOR followed the interbank market as most bankers believe the liquidity problem in the local banking system was temporary," said one dealer.
